</span><span><strong style="color:#000">U.S. markets: </strong></span><span><span>Travel-related stocks got hit by growing fears of the China-based coronavirus spreading around the globe. <div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/21/sports-media-roundup?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Morning Brew Media Day
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc5NjQ1Mzg5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’ve still got a week and a half until the Super Bowl...what to talk about...what to talk about... </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">How about the folks that cover the Super Bowl: digital sports media companies. Some emerging brands are on the fundraising circuit, while others are looking to cash out. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">When the paywall works</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Athletic <a href="https://www.axios.com/the-athletic-fundraising-round-series-d-e7026194-ccc7-4ec2-8415-6b8902c9a11a.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raised $50 million</a> at a valuation of roughly $500 million, Axios reported yesterday. Bedrock Capital led the round, but let’s be honest—it’s much cooler that Matthew McConaughey also participated. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How The Athletic is different: </strong>It’s a digital media company that relies on subscription revenue rather than advertising revenue. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Industry analysts were skeptical that model would work when there’s so much free sports content floating around the web. Heck, even </span><span><em>we</em></span><span> make playoff predictions. But…</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>An impressive 80% of Athletic subscribers stay past one year, Bedrock Founder Eric Stromberg told Axios. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why they’re sticking around: </strong>to read some of the best sports reporting $10/month can buy. The Athletic invested in a roster of top-notch beat writers and newspaper reporters, which has led to a string of successes including <a href="https://theathletic.com/1363451/2019/11/12/the-astros-stole-signs-electronically-in-2017-part-of-a-much-broader-issue-for-major-league-baseball/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">breaking</a> the Astros sign-stealing scandal. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Other companies are looking to sell</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last week, the WSJ reported that Spotify was in <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/spotify-in-early-talks-to-buy-sports-and-pop-culture-outlet-the-ringer-11579302564?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=newsletter_axiosmediatrends&stream=top&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">early talks</a> to buy The Ringer, Bill Simmons’s pop culture and sports outlet. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This appears to be about podcasts:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>After spending 2019 acquiring three podcasting companies for $400 million, Spotify’s in binge mode. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The Ringer reportedly brought in more than $15 million in </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/for-bill-simmonss-the-ringer-podcasting-is-the-main-event-11548673244?mod=article_inline&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">podcast revenue</a></span><span> in 2018, and it currently has more than 30 shows. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Then there’s Barstool Sports. Barstool's owner The Chernin Group is in “<a href="https://www.vox.com/recode/2020/1/10/21060471/barstool-sports-penn-national-gaming-betting-gambling?stream=top&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">advanced talks</a>” to sell a majority stake to casino operator Penn National Gaming, Recode reported. Barstool was last valued at more than $100 million. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The sports media companies flourishing are either experimenting with new business models or aligning themselves with adjacent industries.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/21/netflixs-growth-coming-international-markets?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Netflix Is Bored in the USA
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Netflix HQ" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc5NjQ4ODU1LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Netflix</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Netflix reported its first earnings since Baby Yoda and Reese Witherspoon started tangoing on its turf. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The results? </strong>The company <a href="https://www.thestreet.com/investing/netflix-q4-earnings-live-blog?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">added</a> almost 8.8 million paying subscribers in Q4, beating the 7.6 million it predicted in October. Revenue of $5.5 billion also topped expectations. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The Disney+ damage</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Everyone was wondering how the November launch of Disney’s streaming competitor might impact Netflix. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the U.S., Netflix reported “slightly elevated churn levels” and 180,000 fewer new subscribers than expected. In December, analysts <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2019/12/20/disney-plus-netflix-lost-over-1-m-subscribers-analyst-says/2708831001/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">estimated</a> Disney+ (which got nearly 10 million signups on Day 1) stole over 1 million subscribers from Netflix.  </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">But does it even matter? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Netflix is drooling over the growth potential overseas. Incredibly, international markets accounted for roughly 95% of net new subscribers in Q4. And according to <a href="https://twitter.com/ballmatthew/status/1217494082622312452?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">entertainment expert Matt Ball</a>, Netflix should have better content, lower prices, and less competition outside the U.S. “for many years to come.”</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F01%2F21%2Fnetflixs-growth-coming-international-markets" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86574d1eb82.jpg">

</a>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INDUSTRIALS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/21/former-vale-ceo-charged-homicide-deadly-dam-collapse?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Hammer Drops on Vale Employees
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Vale mine " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc5NjQ0MDgwLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><a href="https://www.flickr.com/people/145872537@N06" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Ibama</a> from Brasil, <a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Brumadinho,_Minas_Gerais_(47021723582).jpg" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Brumadinho, Minas Gerais (47021723582)</a>, <a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0/legalcode" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY-SA 2.0</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, prosecutors for the Brazilian state of Minas Gerais <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-vale-disaster/brazil-charges-ex-vale-ceo-with-homicide-for-dam-disaster-idUSKBN1ZK1XD?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">charged</a> the former CEO of mining company Vale with homicide. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>On Jan. 25, 2019, a Vale dam collapsed, triggering a mudslide that killed 270 people. It was the worst environmental disaster in Brazil’s history. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The former CEO, <span>Fabio Schvartsman,</span> is the highest-level exec <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-21/brazil-to-announce-new-charges-against-vale-for-mine-disaster?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">to be charged</a>. Prosecutors also slapped homicide charges on 10 other former Vale workers, plus five employees of TUV SUD, a German auditor that inspected the dam. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Prosecutors said both TUV SUD and Vale were "fully aware" of the dam's safety risks.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>TUV SUD </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/brazil-prosecutors-file-charges-against-vale-tuv-sud-for-deadly-dam-collapse-11579622098?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a></span><span> it was cooperating with authorities. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>With the tragedy's one-year anniversary coming up, the Brazilian public is looking for accountability, especially since this wasn’t the first disaster involving the company. In 2015, a mining dam owned by a Vale joint venture collapsed, resulting in 19 deaths.</p>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e8657887c532.jpg">
</a>
</td>

</table>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY GROVE COLLABORATIVE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
This Year We’re Gonna Be Non-Toxic
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s arguably too late to be talking about resolutions as it’s basically March. But as a newsletter always striving to be better, we thought we’d add one more to the list (that’s more attainable than becoming less obnoxiously self-aware).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://grove.pxf.io/c/2052726/754475/8442" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">We’re going non-toxic, and we’re doing it with Grove</a>. Don’t worry, this doesn’t mean we’ll stop throwing shade at business bros and startup shamans—it just means we’re now only using <strong style="color:#000">cleaning products that are sustainable, cruelty-free, non-toxic, and most importantly, effective</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As people who barely have enough time to write 3,000 words about tech-evangelism, <a href="https://grove.pxf.io/c/2052726/754475/8442" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Grove</a> makes things easy by delivering these high-quality products straight to our door.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Since nobody wants a metric ton of hand soap, <a href="https://grove.pxf.io/c/2052726/754475/8442" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Grove</a> also lets you customize your box with just what you need. And as a further high five to mother nature, they carbon offset every shipment.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Make this the year you go non-toxic. <a href="https://grove.pxf.io/c/2052726/754475/8442" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Sign up for Grove today</a>.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if !mso]><! -- -->
</div>
<!-- <![endif]-->


<!--[if !mso ]><! -- -->
<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WORKFORCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/21/report-uber-testing-letting-drivers-set-fares-california?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Uber’s California Independence Movement
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Uber <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/uber-is-testing-a-feature-that-lets-some-california-drivers-set-fares-11579600801?mod=business_lead_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">began testing</a> a new feature that grants drivers more independence.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The change: </strong>Drivers ferrying people from certain California airports (Santa Barbara, Palm Springs, and Sacramento) can set the price of their rides. </p> 
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>They can increase the price in 10% increments to up to five times the original fare. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Uber matches riders with the lowest-cost driver available. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In this “bidding” system, drivers can charge more per ride...but may lose riders if they do. Next week, Uber also plans to test a feature that lets drivers reduce fares down to a tenth of the set price. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Other driver perks: </strong>Uber’s now <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/1/21/21075062/uber-test-california-drivers-set-prices-bidding-ab5-law-gig-workers?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">providing</a> more trip info on the front end like travel time, distance, destination, and estimated fare. Plus, riders will be able to pick “favorite” drivers. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The point of the experiment: </strong>Uber is trying to <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/1/9/21058356/uber-app-changes-california-ab5-gig-work-law-driver?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">get around</a> California’s new gig economy law, AB 5. The law, which was passed last year and went into effect on New Year’s Day, all but requires Uber to classify its drivers as employees. With these changes, Uber hopes it can keep them as independent contractors.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EVENTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/21/can-name-international-leaders-davos?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Guess Who? Davos Edition
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We know you can recognize Davos headliners like President Trump, Greta Thunberg, and Klaus Schwab. Wait—you mean you don’t know Klaus? He’s the founder and executive chairman of the World Economic Forum, the organization that’s been putting on this event for 50 years.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">That settles it:</strong> Let’s use the opportunity to put faces to the other important leaders meeting in Switzerland this week. We’ll give you a photo and a brief description, you have to figure out the name (answers at the bottom of the story).  </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Mystery person #1</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1579640523.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup style="display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;"><em><span>World Economic Forum/Valeriano Di Domenico,</span></em> </sup><sup style="display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;"><em><a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/2.0/legalcode?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY-NC-SA 2.0</a></em></sup></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">I’m the first female president of the European Commission. Since taking over in December, I’ve <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/14/eu-making-climate-nuclear-moves-e?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">set a goal</a> for the EU to be carbon neutral by 2050.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Mystery person #2</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1579640716.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup style="display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;"><em><span>World Economic Forum/Walter Duerst,</span></em> </sup><sup style="display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;"><em><a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/2.0/legalcode?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY-NC-SA 2.0</a></em></sup></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">I’ve been the governor of the Bank of England since 2013, though I’m stepping down on March 16 and handing the reins to Andrew Bailey. I’m <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/business/2019/aug/23/mark-carney-dollar-dominant-replaced-digital-currency?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">big</a> into digital currencies. HODL. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Mystery person #3</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1579640839.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup style="display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;"><em><span>World Economic Forum/Walter Duerst,</span></em> </sup><sup style="display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;"><em><a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/2.0/legalcode?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY-NC-SA 2.0</a></em></sup></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">I’ve been the chief economist of the International Monetary Fund since 2018. I got my PhD at Princeton, where former Fed Chair Ben Bernanke was one of my thesis advisors. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Mystery person #4</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1579641039.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup style="display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;"><em><span>World Economic Forum/Manuel Lopez,</span></em> </sup><sup style="display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;"><em><a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/2.0/legalcode?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY-NC-SA 2.0</a></em></sup></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We won't make you guess. That's Klaus Schwab. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup style="display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;"><em><strong style="color:#000">Answers: </strong>1. Ursula von der Leyen 2. Mark Carney 3. Gita Gopinath </em></sup></p>

FROM THE CREW
</h3>

<img alt="Shark Tank cast " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc5NjQzMDE2LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>ABC/Bob D'Amico, <a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nd/2.0/legalcode" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY-ND 2.0</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last week, we asked you to pitch a TV show by replacing just one letter from an existing show. Readers got into it, sending us over 1,700 hilarious responses. Without further ado, here are our picks to win next year's Emmas: </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000"><em>Whose Line Is It Anyway? </em></strong>→ <strong style="color:#000"><em>Whose Lint Is It Anyway?</em></strong> "Someone didn’t empty the dryer again...whodunnit?"</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000"><em>Family Guy</em></strong> → <strong style="color:#000"><em>Family Goy.</em> </strong>"A traditional Jewish family has to come to grips when they find out the mother isn’t a member of the tribe."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000"><em>The Walking Dead</em></strong> → <strong style="color:#000"><em>The Talking Dead</em></strong>. "A show about zombies that just won’t shut up."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000"><em>Shark Tank</em></strong> → <strong style="color:#000"><em>Shart Tank. </em></strong>"Budding entrepreneurs attempt to leave their mark on investors." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Finally, some honorary mentions...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><em>His Dark Materials </em></span><span>→</span><span><em> His Dank Materials</em></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><em>Shameless </em></span><span>→ </span><span><em>Shamuless</em></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><em>Aqua Teen Hunger Force </em></span><span>→ </span><span><em>Aqua Teen Hugger Force</em></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><em>AJ and the Queen</em></span><span> →</span><span><em> OJ and the Queen</em></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe’ve still got a week and a half until the Super Bowl...what to talk about...what to talk about... \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHow about the folks that cover the Super Bowl: digital sports media companies. Some emerging brands are on the fundraising circuit, while others are looking to cash out. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhen the paywall works\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Athletic \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/the-athletic-fundraising-round-series-d-e7026194-ccc7-4ec2-8415-6b8902c9a11a.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eraised $50 million\u003c/a\u003e at a valuation of roughly $500 million, Axios reported yesterday. Bedrock Capital led the round, but let’s be honest—it’s much cooler that Matthew McConaughey also participated. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow The Athletic is different: \u003c/strong\u003eIt’s a digital media company that relies on subscription revenue rather than advertising revenue. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIndustry analysts were skeptical that model would work when there’s so much free sports content floating around the web. Heck, even \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003ewe\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e make playoff predictions. But…\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAn impressive 80% of Athletic subscribers stay past one year, Bedrock Founder Eric Stromberg told Axios. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy they’re sticking around: \u003c/strong\u003eto read some of the best sports reporting $10/month can buy. The Athletic invested in a roster of top-notch beat writers and newspaper reporters, which has led to a string of successes including \u003ca href=\"https://theathletic.com/1363451/2019/11/12/the-astros-stole-signs-electronically-in-2017-part-of-a-much-broader-issue-for-major-league-baseball/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebreaking\u003c/a\u003e the Astros sign-stealing scandal. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eOther companies are looking to sell\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast week, the WSJ reported that Spotify was in \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/spotify-in-early-talks-to-buy-sports-and-pop-culture-outlet-the-ringer-11579302564?utm_source=newsletter\u0026utm_medium=email\u0026utm_campaign=newsletter_axiosmediatrends\u0026stream=top\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eearly talks\u003c/a\u003e to buy The Ringer, Bill Simmons’s pop culture and sports outlet. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis appears to be about podcasts:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAfter spending 2019 acquiring three podcasting companies for $400 million, Spotify’s in binge mode. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe Ringer reportedly brought in more than $15 million in \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/for-bill-simmonss-the-ringer-podcasting-is-the-main-event-11548673244?mod=article_inline\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epodcast revenue\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in 2018, and it currently has more than 30 shows. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThen there’s Barstool Sports. Barstool's owner The Chernin Group is in “\u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/recode/2020/1/10/21060471/barstool-sports-penn-national-gaming-betting-gambling?stream=top\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eadvanced talks\u003c/a\u003e” to sell a majority stake to casino operator Penn National Gaming, Recode reported. Barstool was last valued at more than $100 million. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThe sports media companies flourishing are either experimenting with new business models or aligning themselves with adjacent industries.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F01%2F21%2Fsports-media-roundup\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc5NjQ4ODU1LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eNetflix\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Netflix reported its first earnings since Baby Yoda and Reese Witherspoon started tangoing on its turf. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe results? \u003c/strong\u003eThe company \u003ca href=\"https://www.thestreet.com/investing/netflix-q4-earnings-live-blog?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eadded\u003c/a\u003e almost 8.8 million paying subscribers in Q4, beating the 7.6 million it predicted in October. Revenue of $5.5 billion also topped expectations. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe Disney+ damage\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEveryone was wondering how the November launch of Disney’s streaming competitor might impact Netflix. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the U.S., Netflix reported “slightly elevated churn levels” and 180,000 fewer new subscribers than expected. In December, analysts \u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2019/12/20/disney-plus-netflix-lost-over-1-m-subscribers-analyst-says/2708831001/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eestimated\u003c/a\u003e Disney+ (which got nearly 10 million signups on Day 1) stole over 1 million subscribers from Netflix.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBut does it even matter? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNetflix is drooling over the growth potential overseas. Incredibly, international markets accounted for roughly 95% of net new subscribers in Q4. And according to \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/ballmatthew/status/1217494082622312452?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eentertainment expert Matt Ball\u003c/a\u003e, Netflix should have better content, lower prices, and less competition outside the U.S. “for many years to come.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, prosecutors for the Brazilian state of Minas Gerais \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-vale-disaster/brazil-charges-ex-vale-ceo-with-homicide-for-dam-disaster-idUSKBN1ZK1XD?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003echarged\u003c/a\u003e the former CEO of mining company Vale with homicide. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOn Jan. 25, 2019, a Vale dam collapsed, triggering a mudslide that killed 270 people. It was the worst environmental disaster in Brazil’s history. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe former CEO, \u003cspan\u003eFabio Schvartsman,\u003c/span\u003e is the highest-level exec \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-21/brazil-to-announce-new-charges-against-vale-for-mine-disaster?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eto be charged\u003c/a\u003e. Prosecutors also slapped homicide charges on 10 other former Vale workers, plus five employees of TUV SUD, a German auditor that inspected the dam. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eProsecutors said both TUV SUD and Vale were \"fully aware\" of the dam's safety risks.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eTUV SUD \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/brazil-prosecutors-file-charges-against-vale-tuv-sud-for-deadly-dam-collapse-11579622098?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e it was cooperating with authorities. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eWith the tragedy's one-year anniversary coming up, the Brazilian public is looking for accountability, especially since this wasn’t the first disaster involving the company. In 2015, a mining dam owned by a Vale joint venture collapsed, resulting in 19 deaths.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" Movement\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Uber \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/uber-is-testing-a-feature-that-lets-some-california-drivers-set-fares-11579600801?mod=business_lead_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebegan testing\u003c/a\u003e a new feature that grants drivers more independence.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe change: \u003c/strong\u003eDrivers ferrying people from certain California airports (Santa Barbara, Palm Springs, and Sacramento) can set the price of their rides. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThey can increase the price in 10% increments to up to five times the original fare. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUber matches riders with the lowest-cost driver available. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn this “bidding” system, drivers can charge more per ride...but may lose riders if they do. Next week, Uber also plans to test a feature that lets drivers reduce fares down to a tenth of the set price. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOther driver perks: \u003c/strong\u003eUber’s now \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/1/21/21075062/uber-test-california-drivers-set-prices-bidding-ab5-law-gig-workers?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eproviding\u003c/a\u003e more trip info on the front end like travel time, distance, destination, and estimated fare. Plus, riders will be able to pick “favorite” drivers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe point of the experiment: \u003c/strong\u003eUber is trying to \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/1/9/21058356/uber-app-changes-california-ab5-gig-work-law-driver?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eget around\u003c/a\u003e California’s new gig economy law, AB 5. The law, which was passed last year and went into effect on New Year’s Day, all but requires Uber to classify its drivers as employees. With these changes, Uber hopes it can keep them as independent contractors.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F01%2F21%2Freport-uber-testing-letting-drivers-set-fares-california\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; Davos Edition\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe know you can recognize Davos headliners like President Trump, Greta Thunberg, and Klaus Schwab. Wait—you mean you don’t know Klaus? He’s the founder and executive chairman of the World Economic Forum, the organization that’s been putting on this event for 50 years.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThat settles it:\u003c/strong\u003e Let’s use the opportunity to put faces to the other important leaders meeting in Switzerland this week. We’ll give you a photo and a brief description, you have to figure out the name (answers at the bottom of the story).  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eMystery person #1\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1579640523.jpg\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"640\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;\" alt=\"\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003csup style=\"display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;\"\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWorld Economic Forum/Valeriano Di Domenico,\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/em\u003e \u003c/sup\u003e\u003csup style=\"display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;\"\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/2.0/legalcode?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eCC BY-NC-SA 2.0\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/sup\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eI’m the first female president of the European Commission. Since taking over in December, I’ve \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/14/eu-making-climate-nuclear-moves-e?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eset a goal\u003c/a\u003e for the EU to be carbon neutral by 2050.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eMystery person #2\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1579640716.jpg\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"640\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;\" alt=\"\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003csup style=\"display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;\"\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWorld Economic Forum/Walter Duerst,\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/em\u003e \u003c/sup\u003e\u003csup style=\"display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;\"\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/2.0/legalcode?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eCC BY-NC-SA 2.0\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/sup\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eI’ve been the governor of the Bank of England since 2013, though I’m stepping down on March 16 and handing the reins to Andrew Bailey. I’m \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/business/2019/aug/23/mark-carney-dollar-dominant-replaced-digital-currency?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebig\u003c/a\u003e into digital currencies. HODL. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eMystery person #3\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1579640839.jpg\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"640\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;\" alt=\"\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003csup style=\"display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;\"\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWorld Economic Forum/Walter Duerst,\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/em\u003e \u003c/sup\u003e\u003csup style=\"display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;\"\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/2.0/legalcode?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eCC BY-NC-SA 2.0\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/sup\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eI’ve been the chief economist of the International Monetary Fund since 2018. I got my PhD at Princeton, where former Fed Chair Ben Bernanke was one of my thesis advisors. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eMystery person #4\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1579641039.jpg\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"640\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;\" alt=\"\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003csup style=\"display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;\"\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWorld Economic Forum/Manuel Lopez,\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/em\u003e \u003c/sup\u003e\u003csup style=\"display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;\"\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/2.0/legalcode?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eCC BY-NC-SA 2.0\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/sup\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe won't make you guess. That's Klaus Schwab. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003csup style=\"display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;\"\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnswers: \u003c/strong\u003e1. Ursula von der Leyen 2. Mark Carney 3.
